markdownRemark.html:
Overview

In October of 2019 I joined the Cal Poly Baja SAE racing team, on the Electronics Subsystem, the “electrons.” In the past, it had been a small subsystem of only a few people, but 10 people joined along with me. We were able to take on a more ambitious project as a result. We planned to design a DAQ (Data Aquisition) so that the entire team would be able to analyse the performance of the car during testing in amost real time.

The team had members of varying experience, and as a Software Engineering major, I was most suited to write the communication algorithm so that are various on board computers could communicate to the central data collection arduino without running out of space. We tried several different methods of communication and settled on using serial data transmission.

Once we had the data, it became another task to represent it. After sending over the resulting data to other subsystems, they came back to us saying that it was impossible to graph since the files were too big and woud crash exel every time they tried. Luckily, in my experience programming for SciPy, I had relied upon the matplotlib library to graph data, and it was a fairly simple task to graph what they needed.

frontmatter.title: On the Cal Poly Racing Team
frontmatter.description: Cal Poly Baja SAE is a student run club on the Cal Poly, San Luis Obispo, campus.

frontmatter.title: Student Web Developer; Technology Specialist: Cal Poly Corporation
